Docs.summary: The base token for all of dylan.NET.
Docs.remarks: Any token should inherit from this class if it to be considered a token.
Please do implement a new constructor for new tokens (should inherit this) if they have new fields. The dylan.NET code mostly uses this constructor and not the other one.

Docs.param: The string variable to be assigned to the 'Value' field of the token.
Docs.summary: Constructs the Token object while assigning the given param to 'Value'.
Docs.remarks: Use this as a shortcut when manually porting a token into a class that inherits Token. Normally this constructor is not used so much even though it is supported like the other one. Please do implement a new constructor for new tokens (should inherit this) if they have new fields. Implement both constructors in such cases.

Docs.summary: The line number the token is found in. The line values is the one as calculated by the lexer. This helps debug file making and is really important.
Docs.remarks: Please do not forget to assign the value of 'Line' to the 'Line' of the target inheritor of 'Token' while porting to another object inheriting 'Token'.

Docs.summary: Holds the value of the token. This is the string of characters assembled together by the lexer during its processing of the sources.
Docs.remarks: The 'Value' must be also assigned to the target token's 'Value' when porting a token to another object inheriting Token.
